title: John Teller
text:
John Teller (born March 9, 1983) is an American <a href="freeskiing">freestyle skier</a> who specializes in ski cross. He won the Skier X event at <a href="Winter%20X%20Games%20XV">Winter X Games XV</a>, upsetting favorite <a href="Chris%20Del%20Bosco">Chris Del Bosco</a>.
Teller began his career in <a href="Alpine%20skiing">alpine</a>, but has made the transition to ski cross, supporting his endeavor by working as an auto mechanic. On January 7, 2011, in <a href="St.%20Johann%20in%20Tirol">St. Johann in Tirol</a>, <a href="Austria">Austria</a>, Teller became the first American to win a Ski Cross World Cup race.
Teller is based in <a href="Mammoth%20Lakes%2C%20California">Mammoth Lakes, California</a>.
